text: The line about "extra-functional significance" (a) seems exactly on the point and (b) made me think: writing tends to start as pure, boring function. Early cuneiform is all agricultural and commercial records and stuff. Most code today is still pure function, even if its structure is more complicated. Even artsy code still has a heavy focus on the output. Trying to figure out code as literature today might be like trying to predict _Les Miserables_ when writing is just barely out of the tallying-bushels stage.
